trans-unit.source: Get Started with Mobile Apps by using Xamarin.Forms
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Mobile Apps by using Xamarin.Forms

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Forms development
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Forms development

trans-unit.source: Create a Xamarin.Forms app
trans-unit.target: Create a Xamarin.Forms app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Forms mobile app using an Azure Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Forms mobile app using an Azure Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: You will create both a new Mobile App backend and a simple _Todo list_ Xamarin.Forms app that stores app data in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You will create both a new Mobile App backend and a simple _Todo list_ Xamarin.Forms app that stores app data in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Apps tutorials for Xamarin.Forms.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Apps tutorials for Xamarin.Forms.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free Mobile Apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free Mobile Apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or later.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or later.

trans-unit.source: If you install Visual Studio Community 2013, install [Xamarin] separately.
trans-unit.target: If you install Visual Studio Community 2013, install [Xamarin] separately.

trans-unit.source: You can install the Xamarin tools when you install Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: You can install the Xamarin tools when you install Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: A Mac with [Xcode] v7.0 or later and [Xamarin Studio] installed.
trans-unit.target: A Mac with [Xcode] v7.0 or later and [Xamarin Studio] installed.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]If you plan to build your app on a Windows computer by using Visual Studio, you'll still need access to a networked Mac to do it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]If you plan to build your app on a Windows computer by using Visual Studio, you'll still need access to a networked Mac to do it.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751&appServiceName=mobile), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter Mobile App in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751&appServiceName=mobile), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter Mobile App in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure Mobile App backend
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure Mobile App backend

trans-unit.source: Download the server project
trans-unit.target: Download the server project

trans-unit.source: On your PC, visit the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: On your PC, visit the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, then click the Mobile App backend that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, then click the Mobile App backend that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings** and under **Mobile App** click **Quickstart** > **Xamarin.Forms**.
trans-unit.target: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings** and under **Mobile App** click **Quickstart** > **Xamarin.Forms**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your server project**, click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your server project**, click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Test your backend project locally
trans-unit.target: Test your backend project locally

trans-unit.source: Publish server project to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish server project to Azure

trans-unit.source: Download and run the Xamarin.Forms solution
trans-unit.target: Download and run the Xamarin.Forms solution

trans-unit.source: Here you have a couple of choices.
trans-unit.target: Here you have a couple of choices.

trans-unit.source: You can download the solution to a Mac and open it in Xamarin Studio, or you can download the solution to a Windows computer and open it in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can download the solution to a Mac and open it in Xamarin Studio, or you can download the solution to a Windows computer and open it in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: You can also use both environments and switch back and forth between them.
trans-unit.target: You can also use both environments and switch back and forth between them.

trans-unit.source: Consider these things:
trans-unit.target: Consider these things:

trans-unit.source: It's easier to run the iOS project of your solution on a Mac.
trans-unit.target: It's easier to run the iOS project of your solution on a Mac.

trans-unit.source: You can use Visual Studio on your Windows computer if you want, but it's a bit more complicated because you have to connect to a networked Mac.
trans-unit.target: You can use Visual Studio on your Windows computer if you want, but it's a bit more complicated because you have to connect to a networked Mac.

trans-unit.source: If you're interested in doing that, see [Installing Xamarin.iOS on Windows].
trans-unit.target: If you're interested in doing that, see [Installing Xamarin.iOS on Windows].

trans-unit.source: You can run the Android project on either your Mac or your Windows computer.
trans-unit.target: You can run the Android project on either your Mac or your Windows computer.

trans-unit.source: You can run the Windows project(s) only by using Visual Studio on a Windows computer.
trans-unit.target: You can run the Windows project(s) only by using Visual Studio on a Windows computer.

trans-unit.source: With all of this in mind, let's proceed.
trans-unit.target: With all of this in mind, let's proceed.

trans-unit.source: On your Mac or on your Windows computer, open the [Azure Portal] in a browser window.
trans-unit.target: On your Mac or on your Windows computer, open the [Azure Portal] in a browser window.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your Xamarin.Forms project**, click the **Download** button.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your Xamarin.Forms project**, click the **Download** button.

trans-unit.source: This downloads a project that contains a client application that is connected to your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: This downloads a project that contains a client application that is connected to your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Extract the project that you downloaded, and then open it in Xamarin Studio or Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Extract the project that you downloaded, and then open it in Xamarin Studio or Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Run the iOS project
trans-unit.target: Run the iOS project

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio

trans-unit.source: Right-click the iOS project, and then click **Set As Startup Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the iOS project, and then click **Set As Startup Project**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run** menu, click **Start Debugging** to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run** menu, click **Start Debugging** to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Right-click the iOS project, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the iOS project, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the iOS project.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the iOS project.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.

trans-unit.source: Run the Android project
trans-unit.target: Run the Android project

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Android project, and then click **Set As Startup Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Android project, and then click **Set As Startup Project**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run** menu, click **Start Debugging** to build the project and start the app in an Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run** menu, click **Start Debugging** to build the project and start the app in an Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Android project, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Android project, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the Android project.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the Android project.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in an Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in an Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.

trans-unit.source: Run the Windows project
trans-unit.target: Run the Windows project

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Right-click any of the Windows projects, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click any of the Windows projects, and then click **Set as StartUp Project**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Build** menu, click **Configuration Manager**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the Windows project that you chose.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configuration Manager** dialog box, select the **Build** and **Deploy** checkboxes of the Windows project that you chose.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in a Windows emulator.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app in a Windows emulator.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Learn Xamarin_ and then click the **+** button.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.
trans-unit.target: You'll find the code that accesses your mobile app backend in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file of the portable class library project of your solution.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
